1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdLog.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/26					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
11   |  **		R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	The Tcl module-log routine which provides an	     **
14   |  **			interface to the modulecmd syslog/stderr output.     **
15   |  ** 									     **
16   |  **   Exports:		cmdModuleLog					     **
17   |  ** 									     **
18   |  **   Notes:								     **
19   |  ** 									     **

29   | 
30   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdLog.c.src.html,v 1.8 2009/09/01 20:22:32 rkowen Exp $";
31   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
32   | 
33   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
34   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
35   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
36   | 
37   | #include "modules_def.h"
38   | 
39   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
40   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
41   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
42   | 
43   | /** not applicable **/
44   | 
45   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
46   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
47   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
48   | 
49   | #define	PART_LEN	256		/** Length of the string parts for   **/
50   | 					/** facility list handling	     **/
51   | 
52   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
53   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
54   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
55   | 
56   | /** not applicable **/
57   | 
58   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
59   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
60   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
61   | 
62   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
63   | static	char	_stderr[] = "stderr";
64   | static	char	_stdout[] = "stdout";
65   | static	char	_null[] = "null";
66   | static	char	_none[] = "none";
67   | 
68   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
69   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
70   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
71   | 
72   | /** not applicable **/
73   | 
74   | 
75   | /*++++
76   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
77   |  ** 									     **
78   |  **   Function:		cmdModuleLog					     **
79   |  ** 									     **
80   |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'module-log'		     **
81   |  ** 									     **
82   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
83   |  ** 									     **
84   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
85   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
86   |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
87   |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
88   |  ** 									     **
89   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
90   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
91   |  ** 									     **
92   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
93   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
94   |  **					control everything		     **
95   |  ** 									     **
96   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
97   |  ++++*/
98   | 
99   | int cmdModuleLog(
100  | 	ClientData client_data,
101  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
102  | 	int objc,
103  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
104  | ) {
105  | 	char          **facptr;
106  | 	int             i, len = 0, alc_len = PART_LEN, save_len;
107  | 	char           *faclist, *s, *tmp, *t;
108  | 
109  |     /**
110  |      **  Whatis mode?
111  |      **/
112  | 	if (g_flags & (M_WHATIS | M_HELP))
113  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** ------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
114  |     /**
115  |      **  Parameter check
116  |      **/
117  | 	if (objc < 3) {
118  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
119  | 				" error-weight", " facility", NULL))
120  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
121  | 	}
122  |     /**
123  |      **  Display mode?
124  |      **/
125  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
126  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
127  | 		while (--objc)
128  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*objv++));
129  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
130  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** -------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
131  | 	}
132  |     /**
133  |      **  Get the current facility pointer.
134  |      **/
135  | 	if ((char **)NULL ==
136  | 	    (facptr = GetFacilityPtr((char *)Tcl_GetString(objv[1]))))
137  | 		return ((OK == ErrorLogger(ERR_INVWGHT_WARN, LOC,
138  | 				     Tcl_GetString(objv[1]), NULL))
139  | 			? TCL_OK : TCL_ERROR);
140  | 
141  |     /**
142  |      **  Allocate memory for the facility list
143  |      **/
144  | 	if ((char *)NULL == (faclist = (char *)module_malloc(alc_len)))
145  | 		return ((OK == ErrorLogger(ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) ?
146  | 			TCL_OK : TCL_ERROR);
147  | 
148  |     /**
149  |      **  Scan all given facilities and add them to the list
150  |      **/
151  | 	for (i = 2; i < objc; i++) {
152  | 		save_len = len;
153  | 		len += strlen(Tcl_GetString(objv[i])) + 1;
154  | 
155  | 		while (len + 1 > alc_len) {
156  | 			alc_len += PART_LEN;
157  | 			if ((char *)NULL ==
158  | 			    (faclist = (char *)module_realloc(faclist,alc_len)))
159  | 				return ((OK == ErrorLogger(ERR_ALLOC, LOC,
160  | 					     NULL)) ? TCL_OK : TCL_ERROR);
161  | 		}
162  | 
163  | 		faclist[save_len] = ':';
164  | 		strcpy(&faclist[save_len + 1], Tcl_GetString(objv[i]));
165  | 	}
166  | 
167  |     /**
168  |      **  Now scan the whole list and copy all valid parts into a new buffer
169  |      **/
170  | 	if ((char *)NULL == (tmp = stringer(NULL, strlen(faclist), NULL))) {
171  | 		null_free((void *)&faclist);
172  | 		return ((OK == ErrorLogger(ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) ?
173  | 			TCL_OK : TCL_ERROR);
174  | 	}
175  | 
176  | 	for (t = tmp, s = xstrtok(faclist, ":, \t");
177  | 	     s; s = xstrtok(NULL, ":, \t")) {
178  | 
179  | 		if (s && !*s)
180  | 			continue;	/* skip empty ones */
181  | 		if ('.' == *s || '/' == *s ||		       /** filename  **/
182  | 		    !strcmp(_stderr, s) || !strcmp(_stdout, s) ||
183  | 							       /** special   **/
184  | 		    !strcmp(_null, s) || !strcmp(_none, s) ||  /** null	     **/
185  | 		    CheckFacility(s, &i, &i)) {		       /** syslog    **/
186  | 
187  | 			if (t != tmp)
188  | 				*t++ = ':';
189  | 			strcpy(t, s);
190  | 
191  | 			t += strlen(s);
192  | 
193  | 		} else {
194  | 	    /**
195  | 	     **  bad facility found
196  | 	     **/
197  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_INVFAC_WARN, LOC, s, NULL))
198  | 				break; /** for **/
199  | 		}
200  | 	} /** for **/
201  |     /**
202  |      **  Now, 'tmp' should contain the new list of facilities. Check whether
203  |      **  there has been one allocated so far ...
204  |      **  We do not need the original faclist any more.
205  |      **/
206  | 	null_free((void *)&faclist);
207  | 
208  | 	if ((char *)NULL != *facptr)
209  | 		null_free((void *)facptr);
210  | 
211  | 	*facptr = tmp;
212  | 
213  | 	return (TCL_OK);
214  | 
215  | } /** End of 'cmdModuleLog' **/
